byline.contributor: Saw Nang reported from Mandalay, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok.
byline.original: By SAW NANG and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

abstract: Measles outbreak in remote villages of Naga Self-Administered Zone claims lives of 40 people, of which 35 were children under age 15; inadequate healthcare services and difficulty traveling to distant regions in order to treat illness have compounded deaths.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Measles Outbreak  Kills 40 in Remote Villages
headline.main: Myanmar Measles Outbreak Kills 40 in Remote Villages

snippet: All but five of the victims were under the age of 15, officials said Saturday....
lead_paragraph: All but five of the victims were under the age of 15, officials said Saturday.
